III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency staff refused to pick youth up from the police station.
Investigation Interviews:
On 10/30/24 Complainant reported law enforcement was called
to the facility on 10/30/24 at 10:23PM, regarding Youth A
committing felonious assault against another resident and a staff
member. Law enforcement arrested Youth A and removed her
from the facility. Law enforcement then attempted to take Youth A
to the local juvenile detention facility. However, the detention
facility would not accept Youth A due to her age. Staff 1 refused to
accept Youth A back to Vista Maria. As of 10/30/24 at 11:53PM
Youth A was at the police station without a placement plan.
Complainant contacted Central Intake for assistance.
Attempts were made to contact Complainant by phone and email
on 11/8/24, 11/26/24 and 12/2/24. No response was received.
On 10/31/24 Chief Administrator was contacted by email and
asked to provide an update on the status of Youth A.
On 11/4/24 Quality Manager provided additional information by
email. Quality Manager reported that Youth A was removed from
campus by law enforcement. There was discussion about Youth A
going to the juvenile detention facility. However, the detention
facility would not accept her. It was then determined Youth A
would return to Vista Maria. Youth A was brough back to campus
by law enforcement the morning of 10/31/24.
On 11/7/24 Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility.
Youth A reported she was arrested on 10/30/24 after threatening
to stab staff with a sharp piece of plastic. Youth A stated she went
2

to the police station and fell asleep. When she woke up officers
returned her to the facility. Youth A stated she did not hear any
staff say she could not return to the facility.
On 11/7/24 Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility.
Staff 1 stated Youth A was removed from the facility on 10/30/24
around 10:30PM by officers. There was no discussion at that time
about when Youth A would return to the facility, as it was believed
Youth A would go to the juvenile detention facility due to her
pending assault charge. Staff 1 stated he did not have contact
with officers after Youth A left. Staff 1 was never asked to pick
Youth A up from the police station. Staff 1 did not have contact
with officers at the facility when Youth A returned, as his shift
ended at 12:30AM, and Youth A returned sometime after that.
Staff 1 denied making any statements that Youth A could not
return to the facility.
On 11/7/24 Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility.
Staff 2 reported she was present for the incident with Youth A on
10/30/24. Youth A became angry at a peer when the peer refused
to do her hair. Youth A then attacked the peer. Staff 2 and Staff 3
separated the youth. Youth A then broke a pen and used a sharp
piece of plastic to attack Staff 3. Youth A was chasing Staff 3
threatening to kill him, his wife, and children. Staff 3 was
protecting himself with a pillow, while Staff 2 tried to verbally
deescalate Youth A. Law enforcement arrived and removed Youth
A. Staff 2 stated the officers indicated Youth A would be taken to
the juvenile detention facility. Staff 2 reported she received a call
around 2:00 or 3:00AM that Youth A was returning to Vista Maria,
as she was too young to go to the detention facility. Law
enforcement returned Youth A to the facility around 5:00AM. Staff
1 stated she never heard any staff refuse to accept Youth A back
to the program.
An attempt was made to interview Staff 3 in person at the facility
on 11/7/24, but he did not arrive at work. Attempts to interview
Staff 3 by phone were made on 11/13/24, 12/6/24, and 12/18/24.
On 11/8/24 Foster Care Worker was contacted via video call.
Foster Care Worker confirmed that Youth A had a pending charge
of felonious assault.
Documents reviewed
• Incident report dated 10/30/24, 9:30PM, authored by Staff
3. Youth A was upset with a peer. The two youth were
separated. Staff 3 stood in a doorway to keep Youth A from
3

entering the other youth’s room. Youth A attempted to push
past Staff 2 and Staff 3 multiple times. Youth A then
grabbed a pen, broke it in half and used the sharp part of
the plastic to threaten to stab Staff 3. Staff 3 used a pillow
to block Youth A. Staff 3 requested to be switched out with
another staff. Law enforcement was called at 10:25PM.
Youth A was handcuffed by police and removed from the
facility.
• The personnel file for Staff 1 was reviewed. Staff 1 was up
to date on training and did not have any disciplinary action
on file.
• Unit records indicated Youth A was removed from the
facility by law enforcement at 10:35PM on 10/30/24 and
returned to the facility at 5:30AM on 10/31/24.
Analysis Based on interviews with staff and the youth, there is no
information to support the allegation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
